content: The Act titled "Health Care Assurance for Retired Employees Act of 1996" requires advance notice of material reductions in covered services under group health plans. Effective date for these changes is plan years ending after August 1, 1996. Continuation of coverage for individuals aged 55 and older until eligible for Medicare. Continuation of coverage for individuals aged 55 and older until eligible for Medicare is amended to ensure coverage until the applicable date under subparagraph (B)(iv) with adjusted premium requirements. The amendments made by this section, including substituting '110 percent' for '102 percent' in subparagraph (C)(i), will apply to plan years ending after August 1, 1996. PROTECTIONS UNDER THE MEDICARE PROGRAM FOR RETIRED WORKERS WHO LOSE RETIREE HEALTH BENEFITS. No Premium Penalty for Late Enrollment in Medicare. An amendment is made to the Social Security Act regarding enrollment periods. A special enrollment period is introduced for individuals enrolled in a group health plan due to current employment. A special enrollment period is established for individuals whose group health plan enrollment is involuntarily terminated outside of current employment, lasting for 6 months from the termination date. A special enrollment period lasting for 6 months is established for individuals whose group health plan enrollment is involuntarily terminated outside of current employment. This period begins on the first day of the month when the individual enrolls in part B under section 1837(i)(4). The amendments made by this section will take effect on the specified date. The amendments made by this section will apply to involuntary terminations of coverage under a group health plan occurring on or after August 1, 1996. In cases of termination between August 1, 1996, and the enactment of this Act, a special enrollment period will begin on the enactment date.
